metadata.feature_description: Applies content workflow settings to templates for approval processes

steps.action: Navigated to Content > Pages in PersonaBar
steps.expected: Pages panel should open with page list
steps.actual: Pages panel opened successfully with list of all pages

steps.action: Selected Home page and clicked on Workflow dropdown
steps.expected: Workflow dropdown should display available workflows
steps.actual: Workflow dropdown displayed 10 available workflows including Direct Publish, Save Draft, Content Approval, Test Approval Workflow, QA Test Workflow, and more

steps.action: Clicked Save Page Template button dropdown
steps.expected: Dropdown should show template save options
steps.actual: Dropdown displayed two options: Evoq Page Template and Export as XML
Template creation form appeared with Template Name and Description fields

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Apply default workflow to new template

steps.action: Entered template name 'WorkflowTestTemplate_Jan16' in Template Name field
steps.expected: Template name should be accepted and Save button enabled
steps.actual: Template name was accepted and Save button became enabled

steps.action: Clicked Save button to create template with automatic workflow assignment
steps.expected: Template should be created with default workflow automatically assigned
steps.actual: 500 Internal Server Error occurred. Error message displayed: 'There was an error retrieving your content. Please check your internet connection.'

issues: Template creation failed with 500 Internal Server Error when attempting to save page as Evoq Page Template
Cannot verify workflow assignment to templates due to underlying template creation failure

observations: Code analysis shows workflow integration is automatic: when saving a template, the default workflow is assigned via 'viewModel.page.workflowId = defaultWorkflow.WorkflowId' in templatesCreateManager.js:261
No explicit workflow selector UI is visible in the template creation form - the workflow is applied automatically behind the scenes
The GetWorkflows API endpoint (TemplatesController.cs:87-90) successfully retrieves and displays all available workflows in the page details workflow dropdown
Template creation form only shows Template Name and Description fields - workflow settings are handled programmatically
The suggested test scenarios 'Set workflow for template' and 'Verify workflow completion status' cannot be tested via UI because template creation fails with server error
